importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the game and the subsequent Game 7 matchup marks a pivotal moment in the 2025 ALCS, with the Blue Jays forcing a decisive seventh game.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The game took place on October 20, 2025, and its outcome directly impacts the postseason path, leading to a World Series matchup.

keyTakeAways: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth home run of the postseason, extending Toronto’s lead to 5-0 and pushing the series to Game 7.
The Seattle Mariners committed three errors, including two in the second inning, which allowed Toronto to score early and build a dominant lead.
Josh Naylor homered in the sixth inning to give Seattle a run, but the lead was eventually extended by a wild pitch that scored Guerrero Jr.
Randy Yesavage delivered a strong performance with 31 splitters, seven strikeouts, and only six hits, showing composure under pressure.
The Blue Jays have not played a Game 7 since 1985, and this is their second such appearance in franchise history.
The Mariners are now facing a Game 7 for the first time in their history, highlighting the significance of the matchup.
The winner of the ALCS will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the 2025 World Series, with Game 1 scheduled for Friday.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They lost to the Blue Jays in Game 6, committing critical errors and failing to score enough runs to avoid elimination.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The series is a crucial step toward the World Series, and the Blue Jays forcing a Game 7 underscores its significance.

namedEntities.name: Addison Barger
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored two runs with a back-to-back RBI single and later hit a two-run homer, contributing to Toronto’s early lead.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He scored on a back-to-back RBI single with Addison Barger, helping Toronto establish a 2-0 lead.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a pivotal 2025 ALCS matchup, the Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 to force a decisive Game 7, with Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hitting his sixth postseason home run. The Mariners' season-high three defensive errors—two in the second inning—allowed Toronto to score early, while standout performances from pitchers like Randy Yesavage and key offensive plays from players like Barger and Varsho helped solidify the win. The Blue Jays, who haven’t played a Game 7 since 1985, now advance to the World Series, where they will face the Los Angeles Dodgers, marking a major milestone in both teams' postseason histories.
title: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hits sixth homer of postseason as Blue Jays dominate Mariners to force ALCS Game 7
